data.enText: a duty to deal with or take care of sb/sth, so that you may be blamed if sth goes wrong

data.chText: 我们正在招聘负责欧洲市场的销售经理。
data.enText: We are recruiting a sales manager with responsibility for the European market.

data.chText: 他们有责任确保制度的执行。
data.enText: They have responsibility for ensuring that the rules are enforced.

data.chText: 他们有责任确保制度的执行。
data.enText: It is their responsibility to ensure that the rules are enforced.
to take/assume overall responsibility for personnel

data.chText: 我不愿意承担新的责任。
data.enText: I don't feel ready to take on new responsibilities .
to be in a position of responsibility

data.chText: 我做的这件事，由我自己负责。
data.enText: I did it on my own responsibility (= without being told to and being willing to take the blame if it had gone wrong) .
blame for sth bad that has happened

data.chText: 银行拒绝为这一错误承担责任。
data.enText: The bank refuses to accept responsibility for the mistake.

data.chText: 没有人声称对爆炸事件负责。
data.enText: Nobody has claimed responsibility for the bombing.
a duty to help or take care of sb because of your job, position, etc.

data.chText: 她对雇员有很强的责任感。
data.enText: She feels a strong sense of responsibility towards her employees.

data.chText: 我认为我们在道义上有责任帮助这些国家。
data.enText: I think we have a moral responsibility to help these countries.

ex.chText: 员工没有义务购买本公司生产的产品。
ex.enText: Employees are under no obligation to buy any products from their own company.

ex.chText: 他们不得不履行条约规定的义务。
ex.enText: They have to fulfil the obligations imposed on them by the treaties.

ex.chText: 他出于责任感而替她保守秘密。
ex.enText: He kept the secret for her out of a sense of obligation.

ex.chText: 事实上，履行这些义务需要更多的财力。
ex.enText: In fact, greater resources are needed to meet these obligations.

synonyms.bx: 指法规、合同等规定的该做或不该做的事，含强制之意；也指因诺言、誓言等而必须要做的事。

ex.chText: 该公司对质量作出承诺。
ex.enText: The company made a commitment to quality.

ex.chText: 的受访者表示婚姻应该是一辈子的承诺。
ex.enText: 88 percent of respondents said marriage should be a lifelong commit-ment. 88%
She's got a lot of commitments.

synonyms.bx: 指会去做某事的保证或保证去做的事情。

ex.chText: 他觉得帮助邻居是他的责任。
ex.enText: He feels it is his duty to help his neighbors.

ex.chText: 她从小就被教育要有强烈的道德责任感。
ex.enText: She was brought up to have a strong sense of moral duty.

ex.chText: 切勿忘记你对祖国应尽的义务。
ex.enText: Never forget your duty to your motherland.

ex.chText: 他的职责包括清理草坪。
ex.enText: His duties included sweeping the lawn.

synonyms.bx: 指在道义或法律上应尽的本分，强调自觉性；也指工作职责，此时通常用复数。

ex.chText: 你准备好在新的工作岗位上履行职责了吗？
ex.enText: Are you ready to perform your functions in your new job?

ex.chText: 这个新成立的部门的职能是什么？
ex.enText: What's the function of this newly founded department?

synonyms.bx: 指某人的工作职责或某事物的职能或功用。

ex.chText: 一般而言，升职意味着更多的薪水和更大的责任。
ex.enText: Generally speaking, a promotion means higher salary and more responsibility.

ex.chText: 如有任何变动，你有责任通知他们。
ex.enText: It's your responsibility to inform them of any changes.

ex.chText: 谁应该为这场政治危机负全责？
ex.enText: Who should accept full responsibility for the political crisis?

ex.chText: 她的职责包括分发宣传册和接听电话。
ex.enText: Her responsibilities include handing out brochures and answering the phone.

synonyms.bx: 指管控某人或某事物的责任、对不良事件所负的责任或工作职责，强调对他人的责任。

ex.zh: 财务责任（或职责）；经济责任（或职责）

tr: the social force that binds you to the courses of action demanded by that force
every possession, a duty"- John D.Rockefeller Jr
example: we must instill a sense of duty in our children

tr: the trait of being answerable to someone for something or being responsible for one's conduct
example: he holds a position of great responsibility

tr: the proper sphere or extent of your activities
example: it was his province to take care of himself

value.def: If you have responsibility for something or someone, or if they are your responsibility, it is your job or duty to deal with them and to take decisions relating to them.

example.ex: Each manager had responsibility for just under 600 properties...
example.tran: 每位经理负责将近600处房产。

example.ex: We need to take responsibility for looking after our own health...
example.tran: 我们必须对自己的健康负责。

example.ex: 'She's not your responsibility,' he said gently.
example.tran: “她不归你负责，”他温和地说道。

value.def: If you accept responsibility for something that has happened, you agree that you were to blame for it or you caused it.

example.ex: No one admitted responsibility for the attacks...
example.tran: 没有人对这些袭击负责。

example.ex: Someone had to give orders and take responsibility for mistakes.
example.tran: 必须得有人下令，并为错误负责。

value.def: Your responsibilities are the duties that you have because of your job or position.

example.ex: He handled his responsibilities as a counselor in an intelligent and caring fashion.
example.tran: 作为一名顾问他精明能干、热心周到。

example.ex: ...programmes to help employees balance work and family responsibilities.
example.tran: 帮助雇员兼顾工作和家庭责任的项目

value.def: If someone is given responsibility, they are given the right or opportunity to make important decisions or to take action without having to get permission from anyone else.

example.ex: She would have loved to have a better-paying job with more responsibility...
example.tran: 她本想有一份报酬更高、职权更大的工作。

example.ex: Carrington held a position of responsibility within the government.
example.tran: 卡林顿在政府机构身居要职。

value.def: If you think that you have a responsibility to do something, you feel that you ought to do it because it is morally right to do it.

example.ex: The court feels it has a responsibility to ensure that customers are not misled...
example.tran: 法院认为它有责任确保消费者不受误导。

example.ex: As parents we have a responsibility to give our children a sense of belonging.
example.tran: 作为父母，我们有责任给孩子一种归属感。

value.def: If you think that you have a responsibility to someone, you feel that it is your duty to take action that will protect their interests.

example.ex: She had decided that as a doctor she had a responsibility to her fellow creatures.
example.tran: 她已经决定，作为医生，她应该对自己的同胞负责。

trans: 責任感；责仸感；责任心；责任感；有责任感
责任；企业的社会责任；社会责任感；社会责任；社會責任
责任制；责任体系；责任追究制度；企业承包责任制
负责；对…负责；承担责任；为...负责
企业社会责任，公司社会责任
承担责任；承担责任（或职责）
共同责任；连带责任；共同的责任；连带责任的
责任会计；会计制度；管理会计；责任核算
财务责任（或职责）；经济责任（或职责）
责任中心；責任中心；责任中心制度
